content.question: Despite its visual links to Western abstract painting, Song Su-nam’s Summer Trees demonstrates a clear connection with traditional Korean art through the artist’s

choices.label: use of brushes, rather than a pouring technique, to create the image
choice of a relatively small size for the work
use of oil paint to create black and gray tonal variations
inclusion of drips rather than consistently clean edges

content.answer: use of brushes, rather than a pouring technique, to create the image

topic.text: 10.3: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Global Contemporary Art

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain why a specific work of art (or group of related works of art) demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
